museum.title: Jews of Singapore Museum
museum.subtitle: Discover the rich history and enduring legacy of Singapore's Jewish community through our immersive exhibits and archives

about.title: About the Museum
about.description: The Jews of Singapore Museum chronicles the remarkable journey of the Jewish community from their arrival as Iraqi-Jewish traders in the 1830s to their significant contributions in shaping modern Singapore. Our collection preserves and celebrates this unique heritage for future generations.
about.mission: Through photographs, documents, artifacts, and personal stories, we illuminate the lives of early Jewish settlers and their descendants who became integral to Singapore's development as a trading hub and independent nation.

pioneers.title: Early Settlers & Pioneers
pioneers.description: Learn about the Baghdad-born traders who established Singapore's first Jewish community in the 1830s.

commerce.title: Commerce & Trade
commerce.description: Explore how Jewish merchants shaped Singapore's early economy through international trade networks.

heritage.title: Religious Heritage
heritage.description: Discover the establishment of synagogues, cemeteries, and religious institutions that anchored community life.

community.title: Community Life
community.description: Experience the social fabric, traditions, and cultural events that united the Jewish community.

figures.title: Notable Figures
figures.description: Our exhibits honor the Jewish pioneers who left an indelible mark on Singapore's history:
figures.sassoon: The Sassoon family — pioneering traders who established major commercial enterprises
figures.menasseh: Menasseh Meyer — philanthropist and builder of Chesed-El Synagogue
figures.marshall: David Marshall — Singapore's first Chief Minister and champion of independence

visit.title: Plan Your Visit
visit.hoursClosed: Closed on Saturdays and Jewish Festivals
visit.bookingDetail: Please book your visit at least 3 days in advance.
visit.toursNote: Guided tours available for groups. Advanced booking required.

location.title: Location
location.address: Maghain Aboth Synagogue, 24 Waterloo Street, Singapore 187950
location.accessDetail: Near Bencoolen MRT station. Street parking available.

tour.title: Book Your Visit
tour.description: Schedule your museum visit online. All bookings must be made at least 3 days in advance.

genizah.title: Singapore Genizah Project
genizah.subtitle: A collaborative effort to gather, catalog, and preserve religious books and texts brought by the first generations of Jews to Singapore

about.title: About the Project
about.description: The Singapore Genizah project is a collaborative effort to gather, find, and catalog religious books and texts brought by the first generations of Jews to Singapore. The project started in August 2022 and has since uncovered approximately 700 books of immense historical value.
about.history: The first Jews arrived in Singapore in the early 19th century, mainly from Iraq and India. Prominent families included the Sassoon, Benjamin, Reuven, Meyer, Elias, Ezekiel, Frankel, Ellison and Manasseh families.

discovery.title: Discovery of the Genizah
discovery.description: While attending an evening service at the Maghain Aboth Synagogue, researcher Mordy Miller found an old book printed in Baghdad in the early 19th century containing handwritten notes about the Jews who used it. This discovery led to the systematic collection effort.
discovery.leader: Led by Israeli scholar Mordy Miller

collection.title: The Collection
collection.description: To date, the team has gathered approximately 700 books from the Maghain Aboth and Chesed El synagogues.

prayerBooks.title: Prayer Books
prayerBooks.description: Siddurim for holidays and high holidays, poetry and songbooks

kabbalah.title: Kabbalah & Halacha
kabbalah.description: Including the Zohar and various Halachic texts

historical.title: Historical Texts
historical.description: Earliest books dating to 1833 from Italy

origins.title: Global Origins
origins.description: Books from Baghdad, Livorno, Bombay, Calcutta, London, and Warsaw

discoveries.title: Notable Discoveries
discoveries.description: The project has uncovered numerous significant items shedding light on Jewish history across the region.

farhi.title: Rabbi Isaac Farhi Collection
farhi.description: Books printed by Rabbi Isaac Farhi (1779-1853), providing insight into his journey around the globe in his final years.

marshall.title: David Marshall Dedication
marshall.description: A book dedicated to David Marshall, Singapore's first Chief Minister and champion of independence.

oxford.title: Oxford Prayer Books
oxford.description: Prayer books printed at Oxford University by Professor Moses Gaster, including prayers for the British royal family.

israel.title: Israel Independence
israel.description: A book printed in Livorno in 1948 with the Magen David symbol celebrating the establishment of the State of Israel.

team.title: Research Team
team.description: The Singapore Genizah project is led by Mordy Miller with support from NTU researchers, community volunteers, and the Jewish Welfare Board. A comprehensive book about the project and its findings is currently in development.

mikvah.title: Mikvah
mikvah.subtitle: Ritual immersion facilities for men and women at the Jacob Ballas Centre

about.title: Our Mikvah Facilities
about.description: The Jewish community of Singapore maintains separate mikvah facilities for men and women at the Jacob Ballas Centre on Waterloo Street.

mens.title: Men's Mikvah
mens.locationDetail: Second level of the Jacob Ballas Centre
mens.keyNote: The key is available at the Kosher Shop.

womens.title: Women's Mikvah
womens.locationDetail: Ground floor of the Jacob Ballas Centre
womens.appointmentDetail: By appointment only. Please call to schedule.

classes.title: Family Purity Classes
classes.description: Personal classes on Family Purity (Taharat HaMishpacha) are available upon request. Contact Simcha or Odelia for more information.

location.title: Jacob Ballas Centre
location.address: 24 Waterloo Street, Singapore 187950 (Adjacent to Maghain Aboth Synagogue)

youth.title: Youth & Kids Programs
youth.subtitle: Building friendships and Jewish identity through engaging activities for young people of all ages

about.title: About Our Youth Programs
about.description: Our Youth Activities are designed to provide an opportunity to establish friendships with youth from different backgrounds.
about.mission: From joyous Shabbat meals together to various social activities, these events are meant to stimulate their intellectual, ethical and social development.

shabbat.title: Shabbat Meals
shabbat.description: Join us for warm, communal Shabbat dinners where young people can connect and celebrate together.

social.title: Social Events
social.description: Regular gatherings, outings, and activities designed to build lasting friendships.

holiday.title: Holiday Programs
holiday.description: Special celebrations for Jewish holidays with age-appropriate activities and learning.

community.title: Community Service
community.description: Opportunities to give back and develop a sense of responsibility to the wider community.

programs.title: Regular Programs
programs.description: We offer several recurring programs for different age groups:

ktantanim.title: Ktantanim
ktantanim.description: Weekly program for young children with songs, stories, and fun activities.

vipGirls.title: VIP Girls Club
vipGirls.description: Empowering program for girls with creative activities and Jewish learning.

jli.title: JLI for Teens
jli.description: Jewish Learning Institute courses designed specifically for teenagers.

cta.title: Get Involved
cta.description: Check our events calendar for upcoming youth activities or contact us to learn more about programs for your children.

restaurant.title: Awafi Restaurant
restaurant.subtitle: Singapore's kosher restaurant serving a diverse menu of international cuisines in a warm, welcoming atmosphere

about.title: About Awafi
about.description: Awafi Restaurant is Singapore's premier kosher dining destination, offering a rich variety of cuisines including Indian, Middle Eastern, Chinese, and Western dishes. Our experienced chefs prepare each meal with care, using the finest kosher ingredients to create authentic flavors that bring our community together.

hours.title: Opening Hours
hours.shabbatNote: Closed Friday evening through Saturday for Shabbat

kashrut.title: Kashrut Certification
kashrut.description: Awafi Restaurant maintains the highest standards of kashrut, ensuring all ingredients and preparation methods comply with Jewish dietary laws.
kashrut.supervisor: Under the rabbinical supervision of Rabbi Mordechai Abergel

contact.address: Maghain Aboth Synagogue, Waterloo Street, Singapore

reservations.title: Shabbat Meals
reservations.description: Join us for Friday night dinner or Shabbat lunch. Reservations required.

shop.title: Kosher Shop
shop.subtitle: Fresh kosher groceries, wine, and Judaica from Singapore's trusted community store

cart.title: Shopping Cart
cart.emptyDescription: Looks like you haven't added any items to your cart yet. Start shopping to find kosher products for your home.
cart.shippingNote: Free shipping on orders over ${threshold} SGD. Orders under ${threshold} SGD have a flat ${rate} SGD shipping fee.

checkout.title: Checkout
checkout.paymentDescription: This is a demo store. No actual payment will be processed.
checkout.secureCheckout: Your information is secure and encrypted

success.title: Thank You!

success.demoNotice: This is a demo store for the JWB Singapore portfolio project. No actual order was placed.

hero.title: Welcome to the Jewish Community of Singapore
hero.description: A warm haven for Jewish residents and visitors in the heart of Southeast Asia. Discover our rich heritage, join our vibrant community, and experience authentic Jewish life in Singapore.

shop.title: Kosher Shop
shop.description: Fresh kosher groceries, baked goods, wine, and Judaica items available online.

donate.title: Support Us
donate.description: Help us maintain our synagogues and support community programs.

synagogues.title: Our Historic Synagogues
synagogues.description: Two beautifully preserved synagogues in the heart of Singapore, each with their own unique character and history.

cta.title: Join Our Community
cta.description: Whether you're a Singapore resident or just visiting, we welcome you to join us for Shabbat services, community meals, and special events.

footer.description: Serving the Jewish community in Singapore since 1878.
